1.description: Establishing the Black Tower to train men who can channel. Dealing with political pressures from multiple nations.

15.description: Struggling with increasing hardness and anger. The pressures of leadership weigh heavily on him.

2.description: A former False Dragon who was freed under mysterious circumstances. Offers to help Rand train men who can channel.

3.description: Appointed as head of the Black Tower. Shows considerable knowledge of channeling and warfare.

4.description: Returns from the Two Rivers with new responsibilities and followers. Shows growing confidence in leadership.

45.description: Plays a crucial role in the rescue mission. His abilities prove essential in the final confrontation.

7.description: Leading the Band of the Red Hand mercenary company. His tactical genius continues to grow.

22.description: Encounters nobility and politics in his travels. His luck continues to manifest in gambling and warfare.

12.description: Raised as Amyrlin Seat by the rebel Aes Sedai. Though young, she shows determination to unite the Tower.

27.description: Struggles with being a puppet Amyrlin while working to gain real authority among the rebels.

30.description: In Salidar searching for ter'angreal to help with weather problems. Shows growing skill in Healing.

50.description: Continues developing new Healing techniques while pursuing important ter'angreal for the rebels.

30.description: Working with Nynaeve to find ter'angreal. Her knowledge of ter'angreal construction proves valuable.

35.description: Shows increasing skill in creating ter'angreal while maintaining her claim to Andor's throne.

1.description: Training as a Wise One while struggling with her feelings about wetlander customs and Rand.

29.description: Growing in wisdom and power as she learns Wise One traditions and responsibilities.

1.description: Staying close to Rand, seeing viewings that trouble her. Her visions show both hope and danger ahead.

54.description: Her viewings prove crucial during the crisis. She shows remarkable courage in dangerous situations.

4.description: Supporting Perrin as Lady of the Two Rivers. Shows political acumen in dealing with nobles and commoners.

45.description: Plays an important role in organizing the rescue effort. Her Saldaean heritage shows in her fierce determination.

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Son of Arent son of Halan

43.description: Joining the rescue mission with his Ogier strength and loyalty. His knowledge proves valuable.

55.description: His Ogier abilities contribute significantly to the successful rescue operation.

1.description: Leading Saldaean forces in service to Rand. A skilled military commander with years of experience.

46.description: His military expertise proves crucial in planning and executing complex operations.

10.description: An Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah who has taken an unusual interest in Rand's welfare.

54.description: Takes a shocking action that changes her relationship with Rand permanently.

10.description: A Brown Ajah sister whose studies often take her in unexpected directions. Shows particular interest in recent events.
An Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah sent as part of the embassy to Rand. Shows typical Green Ajah confidence.

55.description: Participates in the climactic events, showing her Ajah's martial traditions.

10.description: A Green Ajah sister accompanying the embassy to Rand. Known for her practical approach to problems.

32.description: A Red Ajah sister and Sitter who leads the Tower embassy to Rand with the goal of bringing him to the Tower.

54.description: Her plans for controlling Rand face unexpected challenges during the final confrontation.

32.description: A Green Ajah sister who is part of the Tower embassy. Lost her Warders to Rand's forces earlier.
A Brown Ajah sister accompanying the embassy, interested in studying Rand and his capabilities.
A Red Ajah sister in the Tower embassy, focused on the traditional Red mission of dealing with male channelers.
A Gray Ajah sister and Sitter in the Tower embassy, skilled in negotiation and diplomacy.
A White Ajah sister in the embassy, bringing logic and reasoning to their mission.

12.description: A former Sitter for the Yellow Ajah who returns to the Hall among the rebels. Shows strong opinions about Tower leadership.

27.description: Becomes a major influence in the rebel Hall, often opposing Egwene's initiatives.

12.description: A Blue Ajah Sitter among the rebels who competes with Romanda for influence in the rebel Hall.

27.description: Works to control the young Amyrlin while advancing Blue Ajah interests in the rebellion.

12.description: Serving as Keeper of the Chronicles for Amyrlin Egwene among the rebels. Former Mistress of Novices.
A Blue Ajah sister among the rebels, known for her motherly nature and concern for others.
A Brown Ajah sister among the rebels, contributing scholarly knowledge to their cause.
A White Ajah sister among the rebels, applying logic to the rebellion's challenges.

25.description: A Green Ajah sister among the rebels, known for her multiple Warders and Green Ajah traditions.

13.description: The deposed Amyrlin Seat, now stilled and working with the rebels. Her knowledge remains valuable despite her loss of power.

27.description: Despite being stilled, continues to influence rebel politics through her experience and connections.

13.description: Former Keeper of the Chronicles, now stilled and working with the rebels. Shows remarkable adaptation to her changed circumstances.

25.description: A former False Dragon who was gentled, now among the rebels. His presence raises many questions about male channeling.

13.description: Former First Prince of the Sword of Andor, now serving as military commander for the rebel Aes Sedai army.

17.description: Mat's second-in-command of the Band of the Red Hand. Shows dry humor and absolute loyalty.
A Tairen lord serving with Mat's Band. Shows the adaptation of nobles to mercenary life.
A career soldier serving as an officer in the Band of the Red Hand. Represents professional military experience.

16.description: A former horsethief turned scout for the Band. His skills in reconnaissance prove invaluable.
A young boy taken in by Mat and the Band after losing his family. Shows remarkable resilience.

30.description: A legendary archer now bound as Elayne's Warder. Her memories of past lives create unique perspectives.
The gleeman continues to provide wisdom and support, particularly to Elayne and Nynaeve in their mission.
A thief-catcher from Tear, continuing to serve Nynaeve and Elayne with his investigative skills.
A Gray Ajah sister working with the rebel Aes Sedai on diplomatic missions.
A Brown Ajah sister among the rebels, contributing her scholarly knowledge to their cause.
Sister to Adeleas and fellow Brown Ajah, working together in their scholarly pursuits for the rebels.

prologue.description: One of the Forsaken, ruling in Illian under the name Lord Brend. Plans against other Forsaken and the Dragon Reborn.
One of the Forsaken known for her psychological manipulation and collection of beautiful people.
One of the Forsaken, known for her sadistic healing practices and torture expertise.
One of the Forsaken, harboring deep hatred for Lews Therin and planning carefully against the Dragon Reborn.
One of the Forsaken, working from within the White Tower to corrupt and control Aes Sedai.

1.description: One of the most respected Wise Ones among the Aiel. Her age and wisdom make her voice influential in all decisions.
A dreamwalker among the Wise Ones, able to enter Tel'aran'rhiod. Training Egwene in the dream world.
A dreamwalker Wise One, working with Amys to train Egwene and guide Aiel decisions.
A dreamwalker Wise One and wife to Bael, one of the clan chiefs. Shows the complexity of Aiel relationships.
Chief of the Taardad Aiel, one of Rand's most trusted supporters among the clan chiefs.
Chief of the Tomanelle Aiel, following the Dragon Reborn across the wetlands.
Chief of the Goshien Aiel and husband to the Wise One Melaine, showing Aiel marriage customs.
Leader among the Maidens of the Spear protecting Rand. Shows the fierce loyalty of the Maidens.
One of the Maidens of the Spear in Rand's guard, showing typical Maiden attitudes and honor.
A Maiden of the Spear serving in Rand's personal guard, demonstrating Maiden dedication.
A Maiden of the Spear among Rand's guards, showing the complex relationship between Maidens and the Car'a'carn.
An Aiel warrior of the Thunder Walker society, serving among Rand's followers with typical Aiel honor.
A young Maiden of the Spear, showing the dedication of younger generation Maidens to their duty.

3.description: A former soldier turned Asha'man recruit, showing remarkable talent for Healing with the One Power.

52.description: Proves his worth as both healer and warrior in crucial moments, earning respect among the Asha'man.

3.description: An Asha'man recruit who seems somewhat unstable, showing the dangers of men learning to channel quickly.
A young Asha'man recruit, showing both the potential and risks of training young men to channel.
A dedicated Asha'man with a family, showing how some recruits maintain normal relationships despite their dangerous calling.
Another young Asha'man recruit, representing the new generation of male channelers being trained.
An Asha'man showing signs of the attitude problems that plague some of the male channeler recruits.
An Asha'man recruit whose loyalty and stability remain questionable as training progresses.

28.description: The former peddler continues his twisted pursuit of Rand, enhanced by both Shadowspawn and Mashadar corruption.

15.description: A dangerous assassin who can move between the real world and Tel'aran'rhiod, hunting in both realms.

1.description: One of the Forsaken, now shielded and forced to teach Rand to channel. His position remains precarious.

56.description: His fate is sealed when he encounters someone from his past who recognizes his true nature.

1.description: Former chief of the Shaido Aiel, now dead but his legacy of division continues to affect the Aiel.
Widow of the former Shaido chief Couladin, now seeking power and revenge among the Shaido Aiel.

55.description: Leads the Shaido in a major action that will have consequences for all involved.

1.description: A Wise One among the Shaido Aiel, supporting Sevanna's bid for power among their people.
A clan chief among the Shaido, following Sevanna's leadership in their separation from other Aiel.
A Maiden of the Spear among the Shaido, representing those who follow Sevanna rather than the Car'a'carn.

4.description: A Stone Dog warrior who has developed loyalty to Perrin, showing unusual friendship between Aiel and wetlander.
A Maiden of the Spear and first-sister to Chiad, showing Aiel friendship bonds and their complexity.
A Maiden of the Spear and first-sister to Bain, demonstrating Aiel relationships and their service to wetlanders.

9.description: Queen of Ghealdan, dealing with the political chaos that has affected her nation in recent times.
The First of Mayene, skilled in political maneuvering and maintaining her small nation's independence.

45.description: Plays an important role in the rescue operations, showing her political connections prove valuable in crisis.

9.description: A Gray Ajah Aes Sedai serving as advisor to Berelain, demonstrating the political nature of Gray sisters.
Former Shienaran soldier who has become a fanatic religious leader, calling himself the Prophet of the Dragon.
One of Masema's followers in the fanatic Dragon worship movement, showing the dangerous devotion of the Prophet's people.

32.description: The Warders accompanying the Tower embassy to Rand, representing traditional Warder loyalty to their Aes Sedai.
Professional soldiers serving the White Tower, accompanying the embassy as military support.

recaps.prologue: The Forsaken meet in Tel'aran'rhiod to discuss their plans and conflicts. Demandred receives new orders from the Great Lord, while tensions rise between Sammael and Graendal. The Dark One's influence grows stronger as various schemes begin to unfold.
recaps.1: Rand continues establishing the Black Tower while dealing with increasing political pressures. Nobles from various nations maneuver around him, and the Aiel maintain their vigilant guard. Aviendha struggles with her training as a Wise One.
recaps.2: Mazrim Taim arrives offering to help train men who can channel. Despite reservations from his advisors, Rand accepts Taim's offer and begins the formal establishment of the Black Tower as a counter to the White Tower.
recaps.3: The first Asha'man recruits begin training under Taim's direction. Rand observes the early progress while dealing with various political delegations. The dangers of men learning to channel quickly become apparent.
recaps.4: Perrin returns from the Two Rivers with new followers and responsibilities. He struggles with his role as a lord while Faile helps him navigate noble expectations. Gaul, Bain, and Chiad continue their unusual friendships with wetlanders.
recaps.5: The Aiel Wise Ones continue their various duties and training. Rhuarc and other clan chiefs discuss their people's adaptation to wetland life. Aviendha's education in Wise One ways progresses despite her resistance to some aspects.
recaps.6: Political maneuvering intensifies as various factions position themselves around Rand. The Forsaken advance their separate schemes, while Rand tries to balance competing interests and growing military needs.
recaps.7: Mat takes command of his growing Band of the Red Hand, demonstrating tactical brilliance in training and organization. His reputation as a military commander spreads, attracting both followers and attention from various powers.
recaps.8: The Band of the Red Hand continues to grow and develop its reputation. Mat's tactical innovations and luck in battle make them a formidable mercenary force, though political complications begin to arise.
recaps.9: Perrin encounters Queen Alliandre of Ghealdan and Berelain of Mayene. Political negotiations reveal the complex web of alliances and obligations affecting the region, while Masema's Prophet movement grows more dangerous.
recaps.10: An embassy of Aes Sedai from the White Tower arrives to treat with Rand. Their intentions remain unclear as they present themselves as negotiators while clearly having their own agenda for the Dragon Reborn.
recaps.11: Tensions rise as the Tower embassy settles in to await Rand's response to their proposals. The Asha'man training intensifies, creating concern among the Aes Sedai about this new development.
recaps.12: Egwene is raised to the Amyrlin Seat by the rebel Aes Sedai in Salidar. Though young and inexperienced, she accepts the role while the rebel Hall attempts to control her every decision.
recaps.13: The rebel Aes Sedai continue organizing their opposition to Elaida's Tower. Siuan and Leane adapt to their new circumstances while Gareth Bryne builds their army. Political maneuvering within the rebels proves complex.
recaps.14: Egwene begins asserting her authority as Amyrlin, though she faces constant resistance from Sitters who want to keep her as a puppet. The rebels prepare for eventual confrontation with the Tower.
recaps.15: Rand's hardness continues to grow as the pressures of his position increase. Dreams and visions trouble him while various threats, including Slayer, continue to pose dangers he must address.
recaps.16: Mat's Band faces new challenges as their reputation spreads. Olver continues his education with the Band, while Mat deals with the complexities of command and the growing attention from nobles.
recaps.17: The Band of the Red Hand's organization solidifies with officers like Talmanes proving their worth. Military discipline and tactical innovation make them increasingly effective as a fighting force.
recaps.18: Mat continues developing the Band's capabilities while dealing with various political complications. His tactical genius becomes more evident as the challenges they face grow more complex.
recaps.19: The Band faces various challenges that test both their military skills and Mat's leadership. Political and military pressures create situations requiring both cunning and direct action.
recaps.20: Mat's leadership skills are further tested as the Band encounters new situations. His supernatural luck continues to manifest in crucial moments, though the burden of command weighs heavily.
recaps.21: The Band of the Red Hand's reputation continues to grow as they handle increasingly difficult assignments. Mat's innovative tactics and natural leadership cement their effectiveness as a mercenary company.
recaps.22: Political complications surrounding the Band intensify as various powers take notice of their effectiveness. Mat must navigate between competing interests while maintaining his company's independence.
recaps.23: Sammael's plans advance in Illian while other Forsaken pursue their own schemes. The Dark One's influence manifests in various ways as the Shadow's plans begin to accelerate.
recaps.24: The Aiel clans continue adapting to their new circumstances while maintaining their traditions. Clan chiefs and Wise Ones work together to guide their people through unprecedented changes.
recaps.25: The rebel Aes Sedai face internal divisions as strong personalities like Romanda and Lelaine compete for influence. Egwene struggles to unite them while building genuine authority as Amyrlin.
recaps.26: Political maneuvering among the rebels continues as various Ajahs pursue their own interests. The challenge of creating unity among the traditionally independent Aes Sedai proves difficult.
recaps.27: Egwene's efforts to establish real leadership face constant resistance from Sitters who prefer a controllable Amyrlin. The rebel cause suffers from internal divisions despite their shared opposition to Elaida.
recaps.28: Various threats converge as Padan Fain continues his twisted pursuit while other dangers manifest. The Aiel maintain their guard duties despite growing tensions from multiple sources.
recaps.29: Aviendha's training as a Wise One progresses as she learns the deeper mysteries of Aiel culture. Her struggles with wetlander ways versus Aiel traditions create ongoing internal conflicts.
recaps.30: Nynaeve and Elayne continue their mission in Salidar, searching for ter'angreal that might help with weather problems. Their expertise in ter'angreal becomes increasingly valuable to the rebel cause.
recaps.31: The search for important ter'angreal continues while various threats, including Padan Fain and Slayer, pose ongoing dangers. Political and magical complications intertwine in dangerous ways.
recaps.32: The Tower embassy continues their attempts to influence or control Rand. Their true intentions become clearer as negotiations reveal the depth of their determination to bring him to the White Tower.
recaps.33: Nynaeve and Elayne's mission faces new complications as they pursue ter'angreal that could be crucial for larger problems. Their skills in ter'angreal creation and identification prove essential.
recaps.34: Various Forsaken schemes advance as Semirhage and Graendal pursue their separate plans. The Shadow's influence spreads through different channels as the Dark One's touch grows stronger.
recaps.35: Elayne's developing abilities in ter'angreal creation become more important as the rebels' needs grow. Her royal heritage and channeling skills create a complex set of responsibilities.
recaps.36: The rebel Aes Sedai continue their preparations while internal politics complicate their unity. Various personalities and Ajah interests create ongoing challenges for effective leadership.
recaps.37: Political complications among the rebels intensify while external threats require attention. The challenge of maintaining focus on their primary goal while handling internal disputes proves difficult.
recaps.38: Mat's Band continues to develop their capabilities and reputation. Political complications surrounding their service create new challenges requiring both military and diplomatic solutions.
recaps.39: The Band of the Red Hand faces situations that test both their combat effectiveness and Mat's leadership skills. Various political pressures create complex scenarios requiring careful handling.
recaps.40: Mat's tactical genius is further demonstrated as the Band handles increasingly complex situations. Political and military challenges interweave in ways that require both cunning and direct action.
recaps.41: Various schemes and plans begin to converge as different factions advance their goals. Sammael's plans in Illian progress while other powers maneuver for their own advantages.
recaps.42: The Asha'man training at the Black Tower shows both promise and danger as men rapidly gain power. The balance between military necessity and the risks of male channelers becomes increasingly apparent.
recaps.43: Preparations begin for a crucial rescue mission as friends and allies organize to help Rand. Perrin, Loial, and others coordinate their efforts while facing significant challenges.
recaps.44: The rescue mission planning intensifies as various groups coordinate their efforts. Political complications and military challenges require careful preparation and timing.
recaps.45: Friends and allies continue organizing for the rescue attempt. Perrin's leadership skills are tested as he coordinates with various groups including Aiel, nobles, and other supporters.
recaps.46: The rescue preparations face final complications as various factors must be coordinated. The Asha'man's role becomes crucial as their unique abilities are needed for success.
recaps.47: Political tensions reach a critical point as various factions position themselves for major actions. The complex web of alliances and enmities creates a volatile situation.
recaps.48: Nynaeve and Elayne's mission faces its climax as they pursue their crucial objectives. Birgitte and Thom provide essential support as the stakes become increasingly high.
recaps.49: The mission for important ter'angreal approaches its conclusion with various complications threatening success. Multiple groups work toward their goals while facing significant obstacles.
recaps.50: Nynaeve's advanced Healing techniques prove crucial as various crises require her unique skills. The importance of finding the Bowl of Winds becomes increasingly clear.
recaps.51: The Aiel prepare for major action as clan loyalty and honor guide their decisions. The Wise Ones and clan chiefs coordinate their people's involvement in the coming conflict.
recaps.52: Final preparations are made as various groups coordinate for the crucial rescue attempt. The Asha'man's abilities become essential while political complications threaten the mission.
recaps.53: The confrontation begins as the Tower embassy's true intentions are revealed. Their plan to control or capture Rand faces unexpected resistance from his supporters.
recaps.54: The rescue mission reaches its climax as friends and allies converge to free Rand. Min's viewings prove crucial while Alanna takes a shocking action that changes everything.
recaps.55: The Battle of Dumai's Wells erupts as Aiel, Asha'man, and Aes Sedai clash in a devastating conflict. The rescue succeeds but at a terrible cost, with consequences that will reshape the world. The Asha'man prove their deadly effectiveness while traditional power structures face unprecedented challenges.
recaps.epilogue: The aftermath of Dumai's Wells reverberates through all factions. Aes Sedai must confront the reality of male channelers while the Asha'man's power becomes undeniable. Rand's rescue changes the balance of power, but the violence and its consequences create new challenges for all involved. The world moves closer to the Last Battle as old certainties crumble.
